bug.author: HarrisonSantiago
bug.description: On python 3.8 I keep getting this error when trying to install: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement torch>=1.3.0 (from stanza) (from versions: 0.1.2, 0.1.2.post1, 0.1.2.post2) ERROR: No matching distribution found for torch>=1.3.0 (from stanza) I have already gone through the FAQs and installed pytorch using anaconda and verified that it successfully installed.

comments.comment:
You should be able to separately install torch first:
<denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>https://pytorch.org/</denchmark-link>
Yes I have already. I still get the error

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HarrisonSantiago>@HarrisonSantiago</denchmark-link> Could you try installing pytorch version 1.3.0 or later with the package manager you're using (e.g., Anaconda), before trying to install stanza? In short, this is because PyTorch didn't make a release for all platforms (operating systems, architecture, etc) when they released more recent versions, and not a Stanza-specific issue.
